column4: does anyone know how to make a Kodak EasyShare C813 work with Ubuntu?
looks like i'll be wasting yet another night
if i can't figure this out soon, i'll just tell my mom she can get XP because obviously none of her stuff is working
nor anyone else who i convert to ubuntu
Why does it have to be kodak?
because i don't have the physical capabilities to turn it into a nother brand
Yeah, there are many ways of getting photos off cameras.  One is to get a MicroSD reader and physically pull the card out of the camera.
do they give those away like the AOL discs?
Go look at your local Wal-Mart.  They're sure to have one or two laying around.  Just ask for a photo card reader.
should i ask them if i can have it for free?
o.o  It's not gonna be free, but it's gonna cost less than $20
well... in a moneyless society, everything would be free
No, in a moneyless society, things would actually cost a whole lot more.  Just not money.
well.. this conversation isn't changing the fact that this camera won't work
Well, I'll tell you right now, a microSD reader is cheaper than a $100 XP license.
no one i know likes Ubuntu except for my sister and she's starting to not like it
i can't keep up with the demands of people and the fuckups of all the companies that aren't supporting major operating systems
